fluff.overview: DiNapoli Industries may be remembered for their licensed production of the Demeter AgroMech, but it was the Opossum SalvageMech with which they entered the market in 3110. The small IndustrialMech was cheaper and more reliable than competitors like the Fwltur while offering similar performance under normal circumstances. Its reasonably sturdy armor and advanced electronics suite also predestined it as a MOD, which first showed up in the ranks of the Twenty-first Centauri Lancers. DiNapoli was taken over by Bannson Universal Unlimited in June 3132, and it is likely that arming civilian machinery, thereby reinforcing Jacob Bannsonâs private army, was a further motive for the buyoutânext to accessing DiNapoliâs DropShip facilities. Of course, the Steel Wolves took control of Ankaa only a few months later and now field the Opossum themselves.

fluff.history:
The success of the Lancersâ MOD has prompted Bannson Universal to introduce for sale a standardized kit to replicate the ad hoc modifications made by Roberson. Bannsonâs illegal military arm, the Raiders, have taken advantage of corporate synergy to introduce a number of modded Opossums into their ranks. Appropriately enough, these Opossums first appeared in September 3132 in a raid conducted by the Scourge against a Belyakov-Ourobouros depot on Fletcher. The defenders were wholly unprepared for this assault and with only unMODded IndustrialMechs at their disposal, they were quickly overwhelmed by Bannsonâs forces. The Scourge Opossums not only performed effectively in a combat role but were able to make use of their salvage capabilities, though reduced by virtue of their modding, to acquire a sizeable haul from the BelOuros depot. This action, as well as subsequent deployments throughout Prefectures III and IV, have inspired Bannsonâs competitors to develop their own MOD packages for their Opossums and other SalvageMechs.
